block.p: Amy Lee Eisner, the daughter of Paula and Mark Eisner of Ithaca, N.Y., is to be married today to Daniel Salo Reich, a son of Tova Reich and Dr. Walter Reich of Chevy Chase, Md. Rabbi Avi Weiss, the bridegroom's uncle, is to perform the ceremony at the Park Avenue Synagogue in Manhattan.

The bride, 28, works in New York as a vice president for operations at MaMaMedia, which operates a Web site and a magazine for children. She graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University. Her father retired as the international telecommunications adviser at the Exxon Company International, a division of the Exxon Corporation, in Florham Park, N.J. He is an associate director of the School of Operations Research and Industrial Engineering at Cornell University in Ithaca. Her mother, who is retired, worked in East Orange, N.J., as an instructor in English as a second language for the Jewish Vocational Service.

The bride, 28, works in New York as a vice president for operations at MaMaMedia, which operates a Web site and a magazine for children. She graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University. Her father retired as the international telecommunications adviser at the Exxon Company International, a division of the Exxon Corporation, in Florham Park, N.J. He is an associate director of the School of Operations Research and Industrial Engineering at Cornell University in Ithaca. Her mother, who is retired, worked in East Orange, N.J., as an instructor in English as a second language for the Jewish Vocational Service.

The bridegroom, also 28, graduated cum laude from Yale University and is a candidate for a Ph.D. in visual neuroscience at Rockefeller University and an M.D. at Cornell University. He is also a violinist and founding member of the Mobius String Quartet.

His mother, a novelist, is the author of ''Master of the Return'' (Harcourt Brace, 1988) and ''The Jewish War'' (Pantheon, 1995). His father, a psychiatrist, is the Yitzhak Rabin memorial professor of international affairs, ethics and human behavior at George Washington University and the former director of the Holocaust Memorial Museum, both in Washington. The bridegroom's father is the author of ''A Stranger in My House: Jews and Arabs in the West Bank''(Holt, Rinehart & Winston, 1984).
